arm_group.description: Periclean is a soft rubber gentle toothbrush

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to observe whether a brushless cleaning device can be equally as
      effective in removing plaque from the teeth as a soft toothbrush. The goal is to give people
      an alternative to bristle brush cleaning if they find they are brushing too hard. The
      hypothesis is that it is possible to maintain healthy teeth and gingiva by using brushless
      methods in conjunction with flossing.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Soft Toothbrush and Brushless Cleaner in Their Ability to Remove Plaque From Teeth

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  18 yrs of age

          -  healthy gingiva

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  less than 18 yrs old

          -  patients with braces

          -  decisionally impaired

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Soft Toothbrush and Brushless Cleaner in Their Ability to Remove Plaque From Teeth

primary_outcome.description: using a periodontal probe gently between the tooth and gum

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Prevention
